alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 8:43PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PHELPS...NORTHWESTERN KEARNEY... SOUTHWESTERN BUFFALO...SOUTHEASTERN DAWSON AND NORTHERN HARLAN COUNTIES THROUGH 945 PM CDT... At 839 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Elm Creek to near Loomis to near Atlanta. Movement was east at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elm Creek, Loomis, and Atlanta around 845 PM CDT. Amherst around 850 PM CDT. Holdrege around 855 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Odessa and Riverdale. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 249 and 267. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Nebraska. A Tornado Watch also remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for south central Nebraska.
